meanings.definition: A person or thing that causes great suffering or difficulty.
meanings.sent1: Dealing with that grueller of a boss is exhausting.
meanings.sent2: The math test was a real grueller for the students.
meanings.sent3: The broken elevator was a grueller for everyone trying to reach the top floor.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending traffic jam was a grueller on our patience.
meanings.sent5: The grueller of a crossword puzzle took me hours to complete.

meanings.definition: A difficult or demanding task or situation.
meanings.sent1: Cleaning the entire house in one day is a real grueller.
meanings.sent2: The obstacle course was a grueller for the participants.
meanings.sent3: Trying to assemble the furniture without instructions was a grueller.
meanings.sent4: The final exam was a grueller, testing all our knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The hiking trail turned out to be a grueller with its steep inclines.
